snippet: When police officers shoot people under questionable circumstances, William J. Lewinski often appears as an expert witness who says they had no choice but to fire.
abstract: Profile of William J Lewinski, psychology professor who is regularly called upon as expert witness to defend actions of police when they shoot people under questionable circumstances; Lewinski, who has been involved in nearly 200 cases, consistently testifies that officers behaved appropriately in using their firearms despite widely disparate circumstances; on stand, Lewinski often cites research showing that police officers simply cannot afford to hesitate.
lead_paragraph: When police officers shoot people under questionable circumstances, William J. Lewinski often appears as an expert witness who says they had no choice but to fire.

headline.main: Training Officers to Shoot First, and He Will Answer Questions Later
headline.print_headline: Shoot First, and He’ll Answer Questions
